question.body: Which of the following is not properly matched with its function?

multiple_choice.choice: Sodium bicarbonate - buffer the acidic gastric juice

response.feedback: Incorrect. Sodium bicarbonate does raise the pH from the very acidic in the stomach to the slightly basic of the small intestine.
Incorrect. Zymogens include inactive forms of protein digesting enzymes.
Incorrect. Amylase does continue the digestion of starch.
Correct. Enteropeptidase converts typsiongen to trypsin.
